summary: This document is a chain of internal FBI emails from December 2020 discussing the approval process for a new client seeking therapy as a victim of Jeffrey Epstein. The emails show FBI Victim Services Division staff questioning the timing, verification of victim status, and financial situation before approving counseling services.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as 'Mr. Epstein', the individual whose actions caused the victimization for which the new client is seeking therapy.

persons.name: M.S., L.M.H.C., C.S.A.
persons.context: A licensed psychotherapist certified in sexual abuse trauma, based in Greenacres, Florida, who reached out to the FBI to inform them they will begin treating a victim of Jeffrey Epstein.

connections.description: The psychotherapist is treating a client who was victimized by Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Scheduled therapy session for Epstein victim
events.description: A therapy session was scheduled to begin for a victim of Jeffrey Epstein with a licensed psychotherapist.

events.title: Therapist informs FBI of new client
events.description: A licensed psychotherapist emailed the FBI to inform them that a victim of Jeffrey Epstein had reached out for therapy.

keyFacts: The FBI Victim Services Division was processing a request for a victim of Jeffrey Epstein to begin therapy in late 2020.
FBI staff internally questioned why the victim was seeking counseling at that specific time and required verification of her victim status and financial situation before approval.
A licensed psychotherapist in Florida scheduled to begin treatment for the victim on December 8, 2020.
The email chain reveals an internal FBI approval process for victim counseling services related to the Epstein case.
